TopicTitle: Share Your 3D KSP Content on Sketchfab

Articles.Content:
<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="480" src="https://sketchfab.com/models/cLeH1Z12bHgdkshoSWcLh7kWKiP/embed" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><span>Sketchfab</span><span>, the leading platform to publish, share and embed interactive 3D content, has announced support for </span><span>Kerbal Space Program</span><span> models. If you make parts or any other 3D creation, you can now upload your *MU files onto </span><span>Sketchfab</span><span> to share with friends and even fellow community members on the </span><span>KSP</span><span> Forum.</span></p>

<p><span>Thanks to the help of TaniwhaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s *MU Importer for Blender, everyone can now enjoy your creations in an interactive, 3D way that brings things to life out-of-game in a way theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve never been before</span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-c207fdef-fac4-f34c-de30-5831853f8407"><br/></strong>Click <strong id="docs-internal-guid-c207fdef-fac4-f34c-de30-5831853f8407"><a href="http://blog.sketchfab.com/post/98386380804/we-have-liftoff-sketchfab-now-supports-kerbal-space"><span>HERE</span></a></strong> for more info.</p>
neato! now we just need a way to export craft files into MU format.
It's time to 3D print some crafts . . .

neato! now we just need a way to export craft files into MU format.

I couldn't agree more. This needs to happen, but I just don't know how. :/

neato! now we just need a way to export craft files into MU format.

You could use the weld mod. Put together a ship, weld it and the mod exports it as it's own part. It's also handy when making big ships

You could use the weld mod. Put together a ship, weld it and the mod exports it as it's own part. It's also handy when making big ships

Oh. I have try that now.
Oooh, this is fantastic! Fantastic for modders, now we can upload our files on SketchFab and all you guys can watch a model interactive, not just on Screenshots!
Hate to break it, but Sketchfab was supported for months already. How is this new news???

Hate to break it, but Sketchfab was supported for months already. How is this new news???

"Can be made to work with" is different from "offers native support"
I guess you can't download from SketchFab. I just looked. Nice to see there's a few KSP models. Look forward to more.
Still is not really useful until we can use craft files with this...

You could use the weld mod. Put together a ship, weld it and the mod exports it as it's own part. It's also handy when making big ships

The welding mod does not create MU files. It only creates config files which reference multiple models.

If there exists an importer for blender, maybe blender can be used to merge all the MU files of one craft into one? It is said to have a powerful scripting interface.

Like the majority, I will wait until I can upload a craft file. Even beyond that, what I'm looking forward to its a "screenshot" button that exports a 3D scene that I can them embed in a forum post, fully rotatable and zoomable! Now that would be awesome.

That said, this whole thing is because one coder made and shared an importer for Blender? Hats off to them, that's really cool!

Even beyond that, what I'm looking forward to its a "screenshot" button that exports a 3D scene that I can them embed in a forum post, fully rotatable and zoomable!

It's technically possible to take a 3D "screenshot" of a scene in KSP, the problem is the tool is rather buggy, and you have to manually locate the files you need in 3DS Max. However it is doable. I just ripped one of the starting scenes from KSP, and extracted the helmet and spacesuit. I would've done the head, but for some odd reason I couldn't locate the mesh for the eyes. The tool used was NinjaRipper, ripped the meshes and textures, then found the two models I needed in Max using the import script, exported that as OBJ to Blender, and then assembled it and uploaded it to Sketchfab.

Kerbal Space Suit by Jacob Thomas on Sketchfab

It's technically possible to take a 3D "screenshot" of a scene in KSP, the problem is the tool is rather buggy, and you have to manually locate the files you need in 3DS Max. However it is doable. I just ripped one of the starting scenes from KSP, and extracted the helmet and spacesuit. I would've done the head, but for some odd reason I couldn't locate the mesh for the eyes. The tool used was NinjaRipper, ripped the meshes and textures, then found the two models I needed in Max using the import script, exported that as OBJ to Blender, and then assembled...

whoof, that's quite a long process, not to mention laborious. Well out of reach for most players. But thanks for mentioning NinjaRipper. I had forgotten about it.

whoof, that's quite a long process, not to mention laborious. Well out of reach for most players.

Oh yeah, not saying it's a perfect solution, but it is definitely feasible. I think the only real solution would be if someone could actually come up with a way of reading a craft file, finding the appropriate .mu parts, and then combining it into a single mesh.

It's a bit of work, even with my own parts. Definitely need something to go from straight craft file to MU. Then there's the not so small matter of linking all the textures properly. But hey Squad... Unity 5 has WebGL export too... nudge nudge wink wink.

RetroFuture Space Plane for KSP by nli2work on Sketchfab

I have plans to add a .craft reader and something to sift through KSP's GameData (to collect the parts), but I'm rather busy with other stuff (life, EL, MFT, animation support for my addon, and occasionally actually playing KSP).

I tried uploading a part, but I then realized that if you have any custom colliders there's no point. I'd have to go into the blend file and remove them, but at that point I might as well just upload that. I suppose this could be convenient for some models, just none of mine.

Ohh yes. Hadn't thought about custom colliders. Just tried it with one of my little parts and it's definitely an issue. I wonder if there's any way of stripping the collider meshes from a model automatically?

The welding mod does not create MU files. It only creates config files which reference multiple models.

If there exists an importer for blender, maybe blender can be used to merge all the MU files of one craft into one? It is said to have a powerful scripting interface.

There is a MU importer script for Blender, I use it. I don't know python script myself, but i would believe adding scripts to it for compiling parts could be done (but it would take ALOT of scripting). This would be an excellent idea for getting around the whole Craft files upload drag.

ok here's mine. sporting rogue fuel lines, struts, and launch clamps.

STS-6E Space Shuttle by inigma on Sketchfab
